articles.title: R spatial workshop
articles.contents:
d-title, d-byline {
  display: none
}



This is the website for the R Spatial Workshop hosted by the University of Utah Archaeological Center during the summer of 2021. The goal is to introduce participants to methods and techniques for working with spatial data in R. Mostly, that means learning how to work with the sf and raster packages. The content and exercises are designed for 3 two-hour meetings.
Who is this for?
Anyone who has (1) a basic understanding of GIS data and operations and (2) a working familiarity with the R programming language. If you feel rusty on this, or are very new to these topics, I recommend reading through the bookdown text listed below.
Text
All lessons are based on Lovelace, Nowosad, and Muenchow (2021) Geocomputation with R. Itâ€™s open-source and freely available here. This is an excellent resource, and something I find myself consulting quite often. Exercises are a mix of the exercises provided in that text and my own additions.
Outline
Day One: Working with sf
Installation and a brief overview of simple features
Attribute, spatial, and geometric operations on vectors
Reading: sections on vectors in Ch 2-7

Day Two: Working with raster
Installation and a brief over of rasters
Attribute, spatial, and geometric operations on rasters
Using simple features in raster operations
Reading: sections on rasters in Ch 2-7

Day Three: Making thematic maps
Making pretty maps
Reading: Ch 8
